intro: Tibouchina stricta, commonly known as the velvetleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom during the warmer months. Tibouchina stricta is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
